alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Gosper (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 9:32PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Gosper and southwestern Dawson Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 931 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brady to 11 miles north of Curtis to 8 miles south of Wellfleet. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Gosper and southwestern Dawson Counties, including the following locations... Farnam. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 209 and 215. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
